author: Roman Shtylman
message: I did something similar when debugging an OpenOffice kde4 bug a while back. I always seem to forget that you can set breakpoints on function calls and constructors. It comes it very handy :)

author: Esben Mose Hansen
message:
catch throw

catch catch

Those two every C++ programmer should know. The first one breaks when an exception is thrown, the second when it is caught. Very useful stuff.

author: Frank Osterfeld
message: Or use Catchpoints: "catch throw" for breaking at any throw, or "catch catch" to break on catch.
